Package modules.data

Class DataBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • modules.data.DataBase
  • public class DataBase
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a data base that is able to read and write data from the txt files under dataFiles folder. All methods are static so easy to use whenever needed

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList> bufferList
      A HashMap to store the read and unchanged data to improve the efficiency
      private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,​java.lang.Integer> bufferMaxIdList
      A HashMap to store the current maximum id of the entity classes e.g.
      private static java.lang.String DIR
      The relative directory where all txt files are stored
      private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,​java.lang.String> fileList
      A HashMap to map a class to its own specific txt file
      private static java.lang.String SEPARATOR
      A separator used to tokenize the records read from txt file
      private static java.lang.String VALUESEPARATOR
      A separator used to tokenize every equations inside the tokenized records e.g.

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList> bufferList
        A HashMap to store the read and unchanged data to improve the efficiency

      • bufferMaxIdList

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,​java.lang.Integer> bufferMaxIdList
        A HashMap to store the current maximum id of the entity classes e.g. Movie

      • fileList

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class,​java.lang.String> fileList
        A HashMap to map a class to its own specific txt file

        A separator used to tokenize the records read from txt file
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALUESEPARATOR

        private static final java.lang.String VALUESEPARATOR
        A separator used to tokenize every equations inside the tokenized records e.g. id=1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIR

        private static final java.lang.String DIR
        The relative directory where all txt files are stored
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • readList

        public static java.util.ArrayList readList​(java.lang.Class<? extends BaseEntity> classObject)
                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                           java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                           java.lang.InstantiationException
        This is used to read data from the txt file Note if no file is changed since last read, it will check the bufferlist and return directly
        Parameters:
        classObject - The class of the objects to be created e.g. Movie.class
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of instantiated objects of specified class from a certain file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown when no corresponding file was found
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - thrown when non-BaseEntity or subclass object was created
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - thrown when non-BaseEntity or subclass object was created
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - thrown when non-BaseEntity or subclass object was created
        java.lang.InstantiationException - thrown when non-BaseEntity or subclass object was created

      • clearBuffer

        public static void clearBuffer()
        This is to clear the bufferList when files are updated

      • readFile

        private static java.util.List readFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is used to read data line by line from a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The filename to read data from e.g. MovieList.txt
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of string
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown when no corresponding file was found

      • setData

        public static void setData​(BaseEntity entityToUpdate)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This is used to save updated data back into files
        Parameters:
        entityToUpdate - A object of BaseEntity or its subclasses, which is newly created or modified
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when failed to read or write the file

      • deleteData

        public static void deleteData​(BaseEntity entityToDelete)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is used to delete one record from a txt file
        Parameters:
        entityToDelete - A object of BaseEntity or its subclasses, which is to be deleted from database
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown when no corresponding file was found

      • getNewId

        public static int getNewId​(java.lang.Class<? extends BaseEntity> classObj)
        This is used to get a new id to help instantiate a new object of a specific class
        Parameters:
        classObj - The class of the objects to be created e.g. Movie.class
        Returns:
        a new Id as integer

      • getMaxId

        public static int getMaxId​(java.lang.Class<? extends BaseEntity> classObj)

      • getObjById

        public static java.lang.Object getObjById​(int id,
                                          java.lang.Class<? extends BaseEntity> classObj)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This is used to get a object, which belongs to BaseEntity or its subclasses, by ID
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the object to be found
        classObj - the class of the object to be reached
        Returns:
        the object with id equals to id; if no such object, exception will be thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - No corresponding object can be found

      • writeFile

        private static void writeFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.util.ArrayList content)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is used by setData and deleteData to write to files
        Parameters:
        fileName - The filename to change e.g. MovieList.txt
        content - A ArrayList of string that will be written into the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown when no corresponding file was found
